 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 3.3 - INPUT ASSISTANCE
LABELS OR INSTRUCTIONS(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input. 

These websites...

Help users avoid and correct mistakes.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A field for entering a date contains initial text which indicates the correct
format for the date. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/labels-or-instructions.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)

 * Subscribe [https://dwcag.org/subscribe]
 * Share Feedback [https://dwcag.org/#feedback-section]
 * Unsubscribe [https://dwcag.org/unsubscribe]
